channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: House Oversight investigating Walz over 'longstanding connections' to China
item.description: House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer, R-Ky., sent a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray, notifying the bureau of the committee’s investigation into Kamala Harris’ running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz.

item.title: Radio's Rickey Smiley hits a raw nerve by pressuring Black voters to back Harris
item.description: A split in the Black community over Kamala Harris has erupted into a melee on social media.

item.title: Good Riddance to Minouche Shafik
item.description: Columbia has an opportunity to behave like an elite American college, but only if the outgoing president’s successors can grasp what she did not.

item.title: Georgia Board To Vote On Requiring Number Of Ballots Cast To Equal Number Of Voters
item.description: 'There’s a fundamental lack of accountability of our secretary of state. Those issues filter down to the counties — which is one reason why the elections board must provide oversight.'

item.title: RFK denies report that he asked for position in Harris cabinet
item.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told guests in his "TikTok Town Hall" live-streamed event that he did not seek a Cabinet position in a potential Harris-Walz administration.

item.title: House Republicans press FBI for more information on Iran's role in plot to kill Trump
item.description: Key House Republicans are demanding answers from the Biden administration about the recent arrest of a Pakistani man in connection with an alleged Iranian plot to kill U.S. officials, presumably including former President Donald Trump, and about an apparent string of threats to American political figures emanating from Tehran.

item.title: The Conversation — Wiretapping America’s Soul
item.description: Coppola’s 1974 movie brings back social conscience.

item.title: You Don’t Need To Be Beyoncé To Sing With Your Friends
item.description: If we revived customs like spending evenings together sharing artistic achievement, no matter how small, we could strengthen communities and heal this country.

item.title: Arizona law requiring proof of citizenship to vote supported by 24 state AGs in emergency stay with SCOTUS
item.description: An emergency application filed in support of HB 2492 in Arizona would require everyone to show proof of citizenship to vote, even with mail-in ballots.

item.title: Three vulnerable Democratic senators will skip DNC
item.description: The three most vulnerable Democratic incumbent senators are reportedly skipping the party's convention next week.

item.title: The Ukrainian Invasion of Russia Is a Game-Changer
item.description: The Kursk offensive’s success will strengthen Ukraine’s hand in any future negotiations with the Kremlin.

item.title: Majority Of Postal Facilities Audited By Inspector General Failed To Follow Election Mail Procedures
item.description: These findings are indicative of a lack of understanding and training with respect to Election and Political Mail policy and procedures.

item.title: Critics blast Harris' grasp of inflation, attack on business ahead of policy speech: 'Lunatic behavior'
item.description: Vice President Harris will unveil her economic plan Friday, striking out against corporate "price gouging," a tack conservative detractors say ignores the real causes of inflation.

item.title: Texas, Heritage Foundation sue to stop Biden administration's 'transgender mandate' in workplace
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton is seeking to block the Biden administration's transgender directive, a newly enacted policy requiring employers to use the opposite-sex pronouns of male-born workers who identify as female and allow them access to women's restrooms and locker rooms.

item.title: J. D. Vance’s One-Track Mind for Railroad Regulation
item.description: A mandate backed by the VP hopeful wouldn’t make trains any safer, but it would damage the ability of the rail industry to pursue automation.

item.title: Everything The Biden-Harris Administration Doesn’t Want You To Know About Its Drug Price Controls
item.description: The Biden-Harris administration's scheme to establish socialist-style price controls is far worse than advertised.

item.title: Minnesota business owners sound alarm on Harris' 'nightmare' VP pick : 'Really bad for the US'
item.description: Small business owners in Minnesota said that it has been a "nightmare" working under Gov. Tim Walz's leadership.

item.title: Trump to resume outdoor rallies with bulletproof glass after Secret Service makes exception
item.description: Former President Donald Trump will reportedly return to outdoor rallies -- but with one change.

item.title: The Week: Trump’s Slip in the Polls
item.description: Plus: Ukraine’s surprise invasion of Russian territory.

item.title: CNN Trots Out B-List ‘Republican’ Coward To Push Voting For National Destruction
item.description: Useful idiots like Geoff Duncan appear 'unburdened by what has been' the disastrous public service record of Kamala Harris.
